election_record.label: Ohio 1816 Governor

overview.note: The Official Certified Vote was 22931 votes for Thomas Worthington, 6295 votes for James Dunlap and 1607 votes for Ethan A. Brown.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The poll list for Windsor has the names of 28 voters but gives no report for whom they voted. These votes could have been cast in the gubernatorial or congressional election.

sub_unit.name: Butler
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Thomas Worthington with 1313 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), The Weekly Recorder (Chillicothe, OH), and The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) list Thomas Worthington with 422 votes and James Dunlap with 80 votes.
The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) lists Thomas Worthington with 482 votes and James Dunlap with 80 votes.

sub_unit.name: Fairfield
sub_unit.note: The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) lists Samuel Dunlap with 78 votes.

sub_unit.name: Harrison
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote has 520 votes for Thomas Worthington.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Thomas Worthington with 1351 votes and does not list any votes for James Dunlap.
The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) and The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH) do not list any votes for James Dunlap.

sub_unit.name: Knox
sub_unit.note: A History of Knox County on 213 lists 485 votes having been cast for Governor with Thomas Worthington with a majority of 424.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Thomas Worthington with 449 votes.

sub_unit.name: Muskingum
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists James Dunlap with 33 votes.
The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) lists James Dunlap with 34 votes.

sub_unit.name: Springfield
sub_unit.note: The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) lists these results as being from the township of Putnam.

sub_unit.name: Richland
sub_unit.note: A History of Knox County on 215 lists Thomas Worthington with a majority of 353 votes out of 470 votes cast.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The October 18, 1816 editions of The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) and The Philanthropist (Hamilton, OH), and the October 24, 1816 edition of the Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) list Thomas Worthington with 1340 votes.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Recorder (Chillicothe, OH) lists James Dunlap with 224 votes.
The Zanesville Express, and Republican Standard (Zanesville, OH) lists Thomas Worthington with 388 votes and James Dunlap with 224 votes.
